p: One common problem of soybean products is their beany taste due to the lipoxygenase-catalyzed oxidation of unsaturated fatty acids in soybean oil to volatile compounds [ 12]. Heat treatment is the most common method used to inactivate lipoxygenase in soybeans, which leads to cooked and toasted flavors. Heat treatment also inactivates anti-nutritional factors, such as the trypsin inhibitor that inhibits digestion and enhances palatability by softening the tissue [ 13]. The contained nutrients may be destroyed if soybeans are over-heated. Therefore, proper heat treatment is the most important requirement for the maximum retention of the essential nutrients in soybean flour [ 14].
